Reporting on loans guarantees (by beneficiary), legal disputes and liabilities from CG and LG is a minimum requirement. The FRS (2022) discloses debt-related CLs, incl. guaranteed debt by beneficiary. The Public Debt Bulletin (2021) discloses also the information (pages 28-29)
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement.The MTEF & FSP (2023-2025) reports on debt-related CLs (pages 43-44), incl. loan and PPP-related guarantees

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The inaugural FRS (2022/23) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 14) and PPP-related guarantees (page 16)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Debt Statistical Bulletin (June 2022) meets the minimum requirement and reports on both explicit and implicit debt-related CLs; Tables 13 & 16). Further details are provided in an inaugural FRS (2022) and a Report on Risk-Related to Main Public Investments (2022)
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The 2022 FRS discloses debt-related CLs, incl. loan guarantees by beneficiary

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimim requirement. The Chapter 6 of the BL for 2022 meet the minimum requirements and reports on explicit and implicit debt-related CLs

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of domestic arrears is a minimum requirement. The Contingent Liabilities Annual Report (March 2022) covers the debt-related CLs with the exception of the domestic arrears covered in the Report on Public Debt, Grants, Guarantees & Other Financial Liabilities for FY 2021/2022 (pages 34-35)

Only reporting on loan-related guarantees related is expected at a minimum. The EFU (2022-2023) covers debt-related CLs, incl. guaranteed debt by beneficiary (pages 43-44). The latest Debt Bulletin discloses also the information (page 6).

Reporting on the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. The Public Debt Report (2022 Q2; pages 3-4) and the In-Year Financial Report (end-March 2022; page 12) report on external arrears and domestic expenditure arrears, respectively. There is not yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs

Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary) is a minimum requirement. The Quarterly Public Debt Bulletin (June 2022) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary. The Fiscal Strategy Statement (FY2022/23) includes a paragraph limited to SOE debt-related CLs (pages 10). There is not yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs

Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary) and account payables is a minimum requirement. The Debt Bulletin (June 2022) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 4) and account payables (page 5). There is not yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs

Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary is a minimum requirement. The Annual Public Debt Report (2021/22) discloses guaranteed debt by beneficiary (pages 29-30). There is not yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs

Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary and arrears is a minimum requirement. The Debt Statistical Bulletin reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 20) and arrears (page 26). There is not yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The MTDS reports on guarantees covering loans (with a breakdown by beneficiary) and PPP (Appendices 1-2). There is not yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The MTDS (2022) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 10). The FRS included in the Budget Policy Statement (2022; Annex 2) fails to report on PPP-related guarantees (pages 82-96)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of domestic arrears is a minimum requirement. The latest Debt Statistical Bulletin (2022 Q2) reports on loan guarantee by beneficiary (page 24) and the stock of arrears (page 12). No statistics could be found on PPP-related guarantees (e.g., the water sector) on the MoF website (incl. in the 2022 FRS; pages 58-59)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. The Annual Debt Report (2021) discloses the loan guarantees by beneficiary (page 25) and the arrears (pages 16-17). The FRS (2022-2024 does not report on PPP-related guarantees (page 29)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and arrears is a minimum requirement. The inaugural Fiscal Risk Report (FRR; 2023) reports on guaranteed debt and comfort letters by beneficiary (pages 33-34) and the Quarterly Debt Bulletin (June 2022) reports on arrears. No statistics could be found on PPP-related guarantees on the MEF website

Reporting on guaranteed debt is a minimum requirement. The Recurrent Budget for 2022 discloses the information (Annex 9). The Fiscal Strategy for 2022 does not yet include a dedicated section on debt-related CLs
No reporting is expected on additional debt statistics. There is not yet a yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs

Reporting on PPP-related guarantees, the stock of arrears and collateralized debt is a minimum requirement. The  Debt Statistical Bulletin (2022 Q2) reports on arrears (pages 7 & 12). The Fiscal Risk Analysis (2021) reports on PPP-related guarantees. No information is yet available on collateralized debt

Reporting on possible unfunded liabilities of the social security fund and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. According to the Pre-Budget Statement 2023, the Tibar Bay Port project is the only PPP at the operational phase, which does not seem to entail guarantees (page  96). No statistics on the unfunded liabilities could be found on the MoF website

Reporting on loan guarantees and arrears is a minimum requirement. The Debt Statistical Bulletin (2021) reports on loan guarantees with name of beneficiaries (Table 12), but fails to report distinctly on arrears

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees, the stock of domestic arrears, and collaterilized debt is a minimum requirement. The Public Debt Report (2021) reports on arrears (page 6) and dedicates a section on CLs (Section 7) with guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 37). It does not yet report on resource-backed loans and PPP-related guarantees. Neither the Budget Statement and Economic Policy for FY 2022 nor the PFM Strategy for 2022-2026 reports on debt-related CLs

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees, the stock of arrears, legacy debt, and collaterilized debt at the minimum. The Public Debt Bulletin reports on guaranteed debt/comfort letters by beneficiary, arrears and legacy debt. No statistics on collaterillized debt could be found on the MFED website

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees, the stock of arrears, and unfunded liabilities from the civil service social fund is a minimum requirement. The Annual Public Debt Management Report (FY21/22) discloses loan guarantees by beneficiary (page 21) and external arrears (page 27). It fails to provide the other minimum required elements

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees, the stock of arrears and collateralized debt is a minimim requirement. The Debt Management Report (2021) discloses loan guarantees by beneficiary (pages 16 & 20) and the arrears (pages 10 & 20). The FRS included in the MT fiscal framework (2022-2024) does not cover additional required elements

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees, arrears and collateralized debt is a minimim requirement. The Public Debt Report (2021) reports no guaranteed debt (page 40) and the stock of arrears (pages 18-19). The collateralized debt is not yet reported

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Statistical Public Debt Bulletin (2022- Q1) reports on loan guarantees by beneficiary (page 14). Statistics on PPP-related guarantees  are not yet available on the MFFE website

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Statistical Debt Bulletin (July 2022) reports on guaranteed debt  by beneficiary (page 30). No statistics on PPP-related guarantees could be found on the MEF website

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Public Debt Status Report (2021) discloses loan guarantees by beneficiary (page 31). The Fiscal Strategy Document makes a brief reference to some CLs (¶64). No statistics on PPP-related guarantees could be found on the MoF website

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Debt Bulletin (March 2022) reports on loan guarantees by beneficiary (page 3). No statistics on PPP-related guarantees could be found on the DoFT website (incl. in the Fiscal Strategy Report)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Annual Budget Statement (FY2021-22) includes a section on CLs with loan guarantees by beneficiairy (page 35). No statistics could be found on PPP-related guarantees on the GPFD website. The Public Debt Bulletin quantifies also loan guarantees by beneficiairy (July-December 2021, page 4)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of domestic arrears is a minimum requirement. The MYEFO (2022) reports on loan guarantees by beneficiary (Table 26) and the stock of arrears (pages 50-51). No statistics could be found on PPP-related guarantees on the DT website

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of domestic arrears is a minimum requirement. The Debt Management Report (Dec. 2021) discloses guaranteed debt data by beneficiary (pages 17-28). The stock of domestic arrears is not yet reported

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. The Debt Statistical Bulletin (2022 Q2) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 31) and the arrears (page 35). No statistics on PPP-related guarantees could be found on the MFNP website (e.g., in the White Paper)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and expenditure float is a minimim requirement. The Monthly Public Debt Survey (June 2022) provides with the stock of guarantees by beneficiary and expenditure float (pages 7 & 9).  Statistics on PPP-related guarantees  are not yet available on the CAA or DGB websites
There is no information posted on public debt on the MoF and CBY websites
There is no information posted on public debt on the MoF and CB websites
The MoF and CB do not have Webpages
Reporting the stock of arrears and collaterilized debt is a minimum requirement. While the debt statistical bulletin (Dec. 2021) reports on arrears (page 12), there are no data on collaterilized debt

Reporting on the loan guarantees and the stock of domestic and external arrears is a minimum requirement. While the Debt Management Report provides data on arrears (e.g., pages 7-8, 28-29, 36), there are no data on loan guarantees by beneficiary]
Reporting on PPP-related gurantees is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MoF website
Reporting on possible PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MoF website
Reporting on loan guarantees by beneficiary and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MFDPE website

Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary)is a minimum requirement. Neither the Statistical Debt Bulletin (2022 Q2) nor the FRS included in the Multi-year Budgetary and Economic Programming Document reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary
Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary) is a minimum requirement. The latest Debt Bulletin fails to do so

Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary) is a minimum requirement. The Debt Bulletin fails to do so (pages 10-11). The FRS included in the Fiscal Strategy does not quantify debt-related CLs (pages 44-47)
Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary) is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MFI website
Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary, collaterilized debt and the stock of  arrears is a minimum requirement. No debt statistics were found posted on the MOFED website

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees, the stock of arrears, and collaterilized debt is a minimum requirement. The DPBEP for 2023-2025 includes a section on fiscal risks (pages 57-59), but fails to meet the minimum requirement

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees, the stock of arrears, and collaterilized debt is a minimum requirement. Only the external arrears are reported in the CBOS External Debt Position at end-June 2022

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Public Sector Debt Statistical Bulletin (Aug. 2022) does not report on guaranteed debt by beneficiary. A list of PPPs is available, but there are no references made to possible CLs
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees  is a minimum requirement. The Budget Statement for FY 2023 fails to meet the minimium requirement (page 80)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Annual Debt Portfolio Report (2021) does not disagregrate guaranteed debt by beneficiary. No additional statistics could be found posted on the DoF website
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found posted on the MOF website
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MoPF website
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MdF website
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. Neither the Public Debt Report nor the inaugural FRS for 2022 meet the minimum requirements

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. Neither the Debt Statistical Bulletin (2022 Q2; page 18) not the FRS (2022-24; page 46) report on guaranteed debt. The FRS reports on PPP-related guarantees (pages 77-80)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of domestic arrears is a minimum requirement. The Report on the Outstanding Loans/Debt Including Guarantees of the Ten Largest State-Owned Enterprises does not disagregrate guaranteed debt by beneficiary. The stock of domestic arrears at end-March 2022 is posted on the MoF website. The FRS included in the Fiscal Strategy Statement for 2022-2024 does not quantify loan and PPP-related guarantees

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. The MT Strategic Planning, 2017/2018-2021/2022 makes a reference to the production of a Contingent Liabilities and Guarantee Monitoring Report, but it could not be found on the MoFP website (page 34)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. The Debt Statistical Bulletin fails to do so. The FRS included in the 2022 BL does not quantifying debt-related CLs (pages 1024-1026)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. The debt statistical bulletin does not report on guaranteed debt by beneficiary and outstanding arrears
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement.  No statistics could be found on the MEFI website
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MEF website

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and external arrears is a minimum requirement. The statistical bulletin (2022, S2) fails do to so. Remaining old debt under negotiation is included in the stock of debt

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and arrears is a minimum requirement. Neither the Annual Debt Report (2021; page 5) nor the inaugural FRS (2022) report on guaranteed debt by beneficiary

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees (e.g., Sinergie concession contract), the stock of arrears and collaterilized debt is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MPFE website
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees  (e.g., Mutsamudu Port) and the stock of external arrears is a minimim requirement. No statistics could be found on the MFBSB  website

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees (e.g., ACE submarine communications cable phase 1) and domestic  arrears is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MdF website
Reporting on guaranteed debt is a minimum requirement. The MoF website could not be accessed
Reporting on guaranteed debt is a minimum requirement. No data on guaranteed debt by beneficiary are available on the MoF website
No information is available
